newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks fall on strong yen, Chicago futures.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks fall on strong yen, Chicago futures.

text.p: Tokyo stocks fell in early Monday morning trade, hurt by the strengthening of the yen against the dollar in pre-market open hours which inspired investors to take profits on blue chip exporters, brokers said.
They added the Chicago Nikkei futures' weak close on Friday was also a factor depressing the market.
By 0011 GMT, the Nikkei average had fallen 146.71 points or 0.74 percent to 19,656.07. Its June futures were down 120 points at 19,710.
"The Nikkei average may try for the 19,500 barrier at one point," Shigeru Okamoto at Kankaku Securities said.
